titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Department of Engineering Records CA.MS.00127
titlestmt.author: Elisha Winkler

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-06 17:09:56 -0400.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
Containers added and finding aid updated as part of College Archives survey

did.abstract: This collection and contains newspaper and magazine articles, pamphlets, and black and white photographs.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Since 1985, Smith College has offered an engineering minor with concentrations in chemical, civil, and computer engineering. Between 1976 and 1991, Smith was partners with the University of Massachusetts in a dual engineering program. The Engineering Department was developed in 2000 and focuses on computer, electrical and environmental engineering.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Department of Engineering records contain describing the history and offerings of the department. Types of materials include newspaper and magazine articles about the development of the program, pamphlets about the department's courses, and black and white photographs of faculty and students.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Department of Engineering Records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00127, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers should also view: RG 42. Faculty

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Please note that prior to 2018, folder inventories were not always updated when new material was added to the collection. As a result, folder inventories may not be complete and folder numbers may be incorrect.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of the 2005 Picker Engineering Program students with First Lady Hillary Rodham Clinton and Sally Katzen Dyk, Class of 1964.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Sally Katzen Dyk, Class of 1964

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The archived website of the Smith College Department of Engineering is captured as part of the larger Smith College archived website.

did.unittitle: Engineers Without Borders - Smith College Chapter website

dao.title: Link to Engineers Without Borders - Smith College Chapter website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archived website of the Smith College Chapter of Engineers Without Borders was first captured in 2018; subsequent periodic captures are scheduled. The mission of EWB is "to implement sustainable engineering designs internationally through community-driven projects.... EWB-Smith College shares this mission and works to create an environment that promotes multidisciplinary and ethical engineering designs, creates international and leadership opportunities, and creates community service-driven global citizens."

did.unittitle: Smith College Society of Women Engineers website

dao.title: Link to Smith College Society of Women Engineers website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archived website of the Smith College Society of Women Engineers (http://smith.swe.org/) was first captured in 2018. Subsequent captures are scheduled annually. Society of Women Engineers (SWE) "has been offering women engineers a place and voice in the engineering industry for more than six decades.... SWE@Smith builds open the SWE values to create and foster a welcoming, tolerant environment for all women involved in the Picker Engineering Program at Smith College.".

did.unittitle: Engineers for a Sustainable World at Smith College website

dao.title: Link to Engineers for a Sustainable World at Smith College website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archived website of Engineers for a Sustainable World at Smith College (https://eswsmithcollege.wordpress.com/) was first captured in 2018. Subsequent captures are scheduled annually. ESW is a project-based student organization. The website (blog) includes upcoming events, current and past projects, and opportunities to connect with other ESW members and Smith alumnae.
